dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 9707 IH: Making Opportunities for Mothers Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Gohmert introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Labor

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Health and Human Services to establish a block grant program to provide incentives to underage mothers to stay in school and remain off of welfare, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Making Opportunities for Mothers Act or the MOM Act.

subsection.text: The Secretary of Health and Human Services shall establish a grant program under which the Secretary makes block grants to States to be administered in accordance with this section.
A State that receives a grant under subsection (a) shall use such grant to pay the cost of—

paragraph.text: child care services for an eligible mother who is a student enrolled in elementary school or secondary school or enrolled on not less than a half-time basis in an institution of higher education, which enable such mother to attend the courses in which she is enrolled; and
child care services for an eligible mother described in paragraph (1) who has employment after attending the courses in which she is enrolled, which enable such mother to be so employed.
The term elementary school has the meaning given such term in section 8101 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7801).

subparagraph.text: The term eligible mother means an individual who—

clause.text: has not attained the age of 18;
has given birth to a child; and
has not been permanently separated from such child.

subparagraph.text: Nothing in this Act shall be construed to make a mother ineligible for payments or services under this Act by virtue of being married.

paragraph.text: The term institution of higher education has the meaning given the term in section 102 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1002).
The term secondary school has the meaning given such term in section 8101 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7801).
In this section, the term State means the several States and the District of Columbia.
